newsitem.title: PERU: Peru govt has legislative powers extended 15 days.
newsitem.headline: Peru govt has legislative powers extended 15 days.

text.p: The Peruvian Congress granted late Thursday a 15-day extension to the government's special legislative powers to allow decrees on the modernization of the public sector and company taxes, officials said.

"We were coming to the end of the (special legislative) period already granted by Congress," said Justice Minister Carlos Hermoza Moya on local radio. "We are still finishing the details on a few things that remain to be done, especially in relation to the modernization of the state, the question of company taxes and a series of important aspects that could not be finished today or tomorrow."

The government's powers -- already extended once by Congress -- were set to expire October 26 after 120 days, during which the executive has produced a wide range of political, economic and financial legislation.
During the latest month-long extension, the government issued decrees on regulations covering the local stock market and investment funds.
Hermoza rejected claims that the government was taking over the role of Congress, where it has a comfortable majority.
But he said the government had been able to decree laws "without very long debates in Congress that take up a lot of time before producing a legal measure."
